Gennady Golovkin is looking to win the IBF middleweight title for a second time tonight as he faces Sergiy Derevyanchenko in New York.

The Kazakh, 37, has to date only lost one of his fights, this came in his rematch against Saul Canelo Alvarez in 2018.

He has been frustrated in his attempts to secure a trilogy clash with his bitter Mexican rival but can at least win back a world title tonight.

The Ukrainian Derevyanchenko has a successful record himself, winning 13 of 14 fights, including 10 KOs.

Here is everything you need to know about the fight…

What TV channel is the fight on?

The fight will be shown on Sky Sports Action with coverage starting at 2am.

What time will the fight start?

Golovkin and Derevyanchenko are due to walk out to the ring at around 4am.

Is there a live stream?

The fight can be streamed on the Sky Go app, just go to the Sky Sports Action channel.

Who is on the undercard?

Ivan Baranchyk vs Gabriel Bracero

Ali Akhmedov vs Andrew Hernandez

Brian Ceballo vs Javier Flores

Kamil Szeremeta vs Oscar Cortes

Nikita Ababiy vs Isiah Seldon

Joseph Ward vs Marco Delgado

Israil Madrimov vs Alejandro Barrera

Latest news

Gennady Golovkin has admitted that he thinks one of his previous opponents has moved away from fighting him and moving to go and fight other opponents.

Canelo Alvarez has moved up to the light-heavyweight and will take on Sergey Kovalev on the 2nd of November.

“Canelo just looks like he didn’t want to box with me or couldn’t box with me, so the only choice he had to go to fight Kovalev.

"The only thing that I see is that he must have had some sort of problem because he was given the option to fight me and for some reason he didn’t.”
description: Golovkin bids to win back one of his middleweight titles tonight as he takes on Derevyanchenko
